attributes.action: Honour our commitment to child refugees - Honour the Dubs Amendment.
attributes.additional_details:
The Guardian 17:50 UTC Friday, 10 February 2017
The government is scrapping Britain’s pledge to take in 3,000 unaccompanied child refugees, sparking fury. Will critics be able to force Home Secretary Amber Rudd to rethink and reverse the decision?
attributes.background: The government has reneged on our commitment to child refugees, having agreed to take only 350. The Dubs Amendment to the immigration bill was voted through on the undestanding that we would take at least 3,000 young people, who are without family and prone to suffer from neglect and exploitation.

rejection.details:
The following petition is similar to yours:
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/183943
